name: Le Bambole armchair designed by Mario Bellini for C&b Italia 1970

condition.details: Wear consistent with age and use.

specifications.rawSpecificationsHTML: Le Bambole armchair designed by Mario Bellini for C&b Italia, 1970. Polyurethane padding, original cotton fabric. The Bambole series won the Compasso d'Oro award in 1979. Le Bambole is an iconic piece of Italian design. included in the permanent collection of the MoMA in New York, Timeless icons, one of the most significant expressions of Made in Italy capable of synthesizing research and imagination, Le Bambole have provided their own personal response to the theme of the seat. What makes them special is the apparent absence of supporting structure, the extreme naturalness of the shape, the synthesis of comfort, softness and elasticity that their appearance communicates with effective evidence. For all the iconic furniture of Italian design follow our gallery SECONDA GIOVINEZZA, we offer restoration service and personalized search.
